Config Management Camp

5 - 7 February, 2018

Gent, Belgium

Maintain and Upgrade Foreman Instance

Kavita Gaikwad

Foreman-Maintain is a supportive tool that helps to keep your foreman and/or foreman-proxy instance(s) up and running. It not only helps diagnose, troubleshoot foreman but also gives an out-of-box upgrade feature.Providing support for most used linux distros such as RHEL, Fedora, CentOS, Debian Foreman-Maintain works on all of them. Foreman-maintain rectifies and fixes issues related to foreman and its services and makes the server ready for selective/auto upgrade. Foreman-Maintain leverages users from going through documentations and steps needed to upgrade Foreman from one version to another.Every run maybe it be health check or upgrade gives user with a status report of the system. It gives a user friendly report easy to read and interpret, one can find it as a cli-command tool but without compromising the FUN part.With Foreman-Maintain you can lay back and sip your coffee rest assured.Foreman users can add custom set of checks using its user friendly DSL. Written in Ruby, Foreman-maintain is completely open source and easy to contribute. Github-repo: https://github.com/theforeman/foreman_maintain

About Speaker

Kavita has developing applications based on Ruby since 5 years. Currently, she is learning swimming into an Open Source Ocean and in water as well ;-) She is nature loving person. If she's not coding, she's playing foosball, badminton and sometimes cricket as well
